title: "Other outcomes DataSchema"
output: html_document

```{r, echo=TRUE}
#Load Opal R library
library(opalr)
library(tidyverse)
library(epiDisplay)

# Connecting with Opal data server
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <- opal.login()
#Login to Opal server and assign the content of the GLOBE table(s) to your RStudio environment
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit0','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit0', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_0 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit0') %>% as_tibble %>% arrange(id)


opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit1','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit1', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_1 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_13082019_visit1') %>% as_tibble %>% arrange(id)


opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit2','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit2', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_2 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit2') %>% as_tibble %>% arrange(id)

opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit3','ROTTERDAM.RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit3', variables =NULL)

ROTTERDAM_3 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RSII_MINDMAP_18102019_visit3') %>% as_tibble %>% arrange(id)



```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}
oth_ROTTERDAM_0 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_0$id, stringsAsFactors = F) %>% as_tibble %>% arrange(id)
oth_ROTTERDAM_1 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_1$id, stringsAsFactors = F) %>% as_tibble %>% arrange(id)
oth_ROTTERDAM_2 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_2$id, stringsAsFactors = F) %>% as_tibble %>% arrange(id)
oth_ROTTERDAM_3 <- data.frame(id = ROTTERDAM_3$id, stringsAsFactors = F) %>% as_tibble %>% arrange(id)
```
## When you are done with your work, logout of Opal server
```{r, echo=FALSE}
opal.logout(erasmus_opal)
```

**Variable name**: dis_hbp_ever_0  
**Variable description**:  Occurrence of high blood pressure or hypertension at any point during the life of the participant.   
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  N/A  
**Category coding:**  
  
**Code**   | **Category Label**    
-----------| -------------  
0          |  Never had high blood pressure or hypertension  
1          |  Ever had high blood pressure or hypertension  

**Harmonization status**: complete   
**Harmonization comment**: Study-specific variable 'Was a high blood pressure ever measured?' used.

```{r, echo=TRUE}

```

# Myocardial infarction subdomain

### **Variable label**: Lifetime occurrence of myocardial infarction    
**Variable name**:  dis_mi_ever_0  
**Variable description**:  Occurrence of myocardial infarction (heart attack) at any point during the life of the participant.    
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
---------| -------------  
0        |   Never had myocardial infarction
1        |   Ever had myocardial infarction  

**Harmonization status**: complete     
**Harmonization comment**:  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}

# table(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9a, useNA="always")
# table(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9d, useNA="always")
# table(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9d,ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9a, useNA="always")

MyMerge <- function(x,y){
  merge(x,y, by= c("id"),all=TRUE)
}

ROTTERDAM_2$startage2 <-ROTTERDAM_2$startage
ROTTERDAM_2$startdat2 <-ROTTERDAM_2$startdat

ROTTERDAM_3$startage3 <-ROTTERDAM_3$startage
ROTTERDAM_3$startdat3 <-ROTTERDAM_3$startdat

med_table <- Reduce(MyMerge, list(ROTTERDAM_0,ROTTERDAM_1,ROTTERDAM_2,ROTTERDAM_3))

# changed second condition (for 1 Ever had myocardial infarction ) to OR statement
med_table$dis_mi_ever_0 <-ifelse(med_table$ep_pimc9d==88 & med_table$ep_pimc9a==88, 0L,
                                       ifelse(med_table$ep_pimc9d<77 | med_table$ep_pimc9a<77,1L, NA))

oth_ROTTERDAM_0<-merge(oth_ROTTERDAM_0,med_table[,c("id","dis_mi_ever_0")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)

# table(oth_ROTTERDAM_0$dis_mi_ever_0, useNA="always")

```

### **Variable label**: Age at first Myocardial infarction  
**Variable name**:  dis_mi_age_0  
**Variable description**:  Age of the participant at time of first myocardial infarction.  
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  years  
**Category coding**: N/A  
         
**Harmonization status**: complete    
**Harmonization comment**:  Study-specific variables 'Age at time of first heart attack with admission' and 'Age at time of first heart attack without admission' are dates. Harmonized variable calculated from 'Age at entering the Rotterdam Study' minus years difference between 'Date of entering the Rotterdam Study' and earlier of 'Age at time of first heart attack' variables.
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
# table(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9b, useNA="always")
# table(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9e, useNA="always")
# table(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9b, is.na(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9e), useNA="always")

med_table$ep_pimc9b_yr <- as.integer(substr(med_table$ep_pimc9b, 1,4))
med_table$ep_pimc9e_yr <- as.integer(substr(med_table$ep_pimc9e, 1,4))
med_table$startdat_yr <- as.integer(substr(med_table$startdat.x, 1,4))

med_table$dis_mi_age_0 <- with(med_table,
                               ifelse(is.na(ep_pimc9b_yr), startage.x - (startdat_yr-ep_pimc9e_yr), 
                                      ifelse(is.na(ep_pimc9e_yr), startage.x - (startdat_yr-ep_pimc9b_yr), 
                                             ifelse(ep_pimc9b_yr < ep_pimc9e_yr, startage.x - (startdat_yr-ep_pimc9b_yr), 
                                                    startage.x - (startdat_yr-ep_pimc9e_yr))))
                                     )
oth_ROTTERDAM_0 <- merge(oth_ROTTERDAM_0, med_table[,c("id","dis_mi_age_0")])

# oth_ROTTERDAM_0$dis_mi_age_0 <-ifelse ((as.integer(substr(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9b, 1,4)))<(as.integer(substr(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9e, 1,4))), 
#                              ROTTERDAM_0$startage-((as.integer(substr(ROTTERDAM_0$startdat, 1,4)))-as.integer(substr(ROTTERDAM_0$ep_pimc9b, 1,4))),
```  
